negotiator.protocol

Class AlternatingMajorityConsensusProtocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • negotiator.protocol.DefaultMultilateralProtocol
      • negotiator.protocol.AlternatingMultipleOffersProtocol
        • negotiator.protocol.AlternatingMajorityConsensusProtocol
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MultilateralProtocol

    public class AlternatingMajorityConsensusProtocol
extends AlternatingMultipleOffersProtocol
    Implementation of an alternating offer protocol using majority voting. This is essentially equal to the AlternatingMultipleOffersProtocol but now an offer is accepted if the majority (instead of all) accept.

    Protocol: 

     Round 1 (offers): Each agent makes an offer
 Round 2 (voting): Each agent votes for each offer on the table
 
 The offer that is supported by the most parties, will stay on the table.
 If a new offer has more supporting parties, it overwrites the old offer.
 This protocol always has some agreement.
 
 When deadline reached, the most recent agreement will be considered the final agreement.
    Author:
    David Festen, Reyhan, W.Pasman removed all code except acceptedOffer and extend existing AMOP

    • Method Detail

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished(Session session,
                 java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        Description copied from interface: MultilateralProtocol
        Check if the protocol is done or still busy. If this method returns true, the SessionManager will not start a new Round after the current one. It will however finish all the turns described in the MultilateralProtocol.getRoundStructure(java.util.List, negotiator.session.Session) method.
        Specified by:
        isFinished in interface MultilateralProtocol
        Overrides:
        isFinished in class AlternatingMultipleOffersProtocol
        Parameters:
        session - the current state of this session
        parties - all the parties involved in the negotiation
        Returns:
        true if the protocol is finished

      • acceptedOffer

        protected Offer acceptedOffer(Round votingRound,
                  Round offerRound)
        returns the first offer with more support than the current one, or null if no such offer.
        Overrides:
        acceptedOffer in class AlternatingMultipleOffersProtocol
        Parameters:
        votingRound - the round with the voting (expected number of turns is agent# * agent#)
        offerRound - the round with the offers (expected number of turns is agent#)
        Returns:
        The best offer on the table
